title: Beth Hamedrash Hagodol
summary: Beth Hamedrash Hagodol[10][11][12][13] (Hebrew: בֵּית הַמִּדְרָש הַגָּדוֹל‎, "Great Study House") is an Orthodox Jewish congregation that for over 120 years was located in a historic building at 60–64 Norfolk Street between Grand and Broome Streets in the Lower East Side neighborhood of Manhattan, New York City. It was the first Eastern European congregation founded in New York City and the oldest Russian Jewish Orthodox congregation in the United States.[5]
